block_comment: This block of code declares and assigns values to two wire elements: "write_hit" and "write_miss". These elements represent write operation statuses within a cache memory architecture designed with Verilog. "write_hit" is used to indicate successful data writing when the enable signal, write request signal, and cache hit signal are all ON. Meanwhile, "write_miss" implies a cache miss event under active enable and write request signals, and when the cache state is different from the "CS_WRITE_HIT1" state; it implies unsuccessful data writing due to a missing required address in the cache. This subsequent write miss is to be handled by further logic not represented in this particular block.
